questions.stem: In a reaction, $$\text{OH} \rightarrow \text{COOCH}_3 \rightarrow \text{OH} \rightarrow \text{COOH}$$, reagents 'X' and 'Y' respectively are:
questions.explanation: The reaction involves esterification followed by hydrolysis. The correct reagents are acetic anhydride and methanol in acidic conditions.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.tip_formula: Use acetic anhydride for esterification.

questions.stem: The correct order of bond enthalpy (kJ mol$$^{-1}$$) is:
questions.explanation: The bond enthalpy generally decreases down the group in the periodic table. Carbon-carbon bonds are stronger than silicon-silicon bonds.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.tip_formula: Remember bond strength trends in the periodic table.

questions.stem: All structures given below are of vitamin C. Most stable of them is:
questions.explanation: The most stable structure of vitamin C is stabilized by intramolecular hydrogen bonding.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.tip_formula: Look for intramolecular hydrogen bonds for stability.

questions.stem: The graph which represents the following reaction is: $$\text{(C}_6\text{H}_5)_3\text{CCl} \rightarrow \text{(C}_6\text{H}_5)_3\text{COH}$$
questions.explanation: This is an $$S_N1$$ reaction, so the rate depends only on the concentration of the alkyl halide.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.tip_formula: For $$S_N1$$, rate depends on substrate concentration.

questions.stem: The complex cation which has two isomers is:
questions.explanation: The complex $$[\text{Co(NH}_3)_5\text{NO}_2]^{2+}$$ can form linkage isomers due to the ambidentate nature of $$\text{NO}_2$$.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.tip_formula: Look for ambidentate ligands for isomerism.

questions.stem: Given below are two statements: Statement I: Sulphanilic acid gives esterification test for carboxyl group. Statement II: Sulphanilic acid gives red colour in Lassigne’s test for extra element detection.

options.text: Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.

questions.explanation: Sulphanilic acid does not show esterification test but gives a red color in Lassigne’s test due to the presence of sulfur and nitrogen.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.tip_formula: Remember specific tests for functional groups.

questions.stem: Given below are two statements: Assertion (A): Gypsum is used for making fireproof wall boards. Reason (R): Gypsum is unstable at high temperatures.

options.text: Both (A) and (R) are correct but (R) is not the correct explanation of (A).
(A) is correct but (R) is not correct.
(A) is not correct but (R) is correct.
Both (A) and (R) are correct and (R) is the correct explanation of (A).

questions.explanation: Gypsum is used for fireproofing due to its ability to release water when heated, which helps in cooling, not because it is unstable.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.tip_formula: Understand the properties of gypsum for fireproofing.

questions.stem: Which element is not present in Nessler’s reagent?
questions.explanation: Nessler’s reagent is $$\text{K}_2[\text{HgI}_4]$$, which contains mercury, potassium, and iodine but not oxygen.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.tip_formula: Memorize the composition of common reagents.

questions.stem: Given below are two statements: Assertion (A): $$\alpha$$-halocarboxylic acid on reaction with dil. $$\text{NH}_3$$ gives good yield of $$\alpha$$-amino carboxylic acid whereas the yield of amines is very low when prepared from alkyl halides. Reason (R): Amino acids exist in zwitter ion form in aqueous medium.

options.text: Both (A) and (R) are correct and (R) is the correct explanation of (A).
Both (A) and (R) are correct but (R) is not the correct explanation of (A).
(A) is correct but (R) is not correct.
(A) is not correct but (R) is correct.

questions.explanation: The zwitterionic form of amino acids stabilizes them in solution, making the reaction with $$\alpha$$-halocarboxylic acids more favorable.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.tip_formula: Understand the stability of zwitterions in reactions.

questions.stem: The industrial activity held least responsible for global warming is:

options.text: Electricity generation in thermal power plants

questions.explanation: Urea production consumes $$\text{NH}_3$$ and $$\text{CO}_2$$, thus contributing less to global warming compared to other industrial activities.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.tip_formula: Identify processes that consume greenhouse gases.

questions.stem: The starting material for convenient preparation of deuterated hydrogen peroxide ($$\text{D}_2\text{O}_2$$) in laboratory is:
questions.explanation: The reaction $$\text{K}_2\text{S}_2\text{O}_8 + 2\text{D}_2\text{O} \rightarrow 2\text{KDSO}_4 + \text{D}_2\text{O}_2$$ is used to prepare deuterated hydrogen peroxide.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.tip_formula: Use $$\text{K}_2\text{S}_2\text{O}_8$$ for deuterated $$\text{H}_2\text{O}_2$$.

questions.stem: In the Freundlich adsorption isotherm, the value of $$\frac{1}{n}$$ and $$\log K$$ are respectively:
questions.explanation: The equation $$\log \left(\frac{x}{m}\right) = \frac{1}{n} \log P + \log K$$ gives $$\frac{1}{n} = 3$$ and $$\log K = 2.505$$.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.tip_formula: Use Freundlich isotherm for adsorption calculations.

questions.stem: Assertion (A): An aqueous solution of KOH when used for volumetric analysis, its concentration should be checked before use. Reason (R): On aging, KOH solution absorbs atmospheric $$\text{CO}_2$$.

options.text: (A) is not correct but (R) is correct
Both (A) and (R) are correct but (R) is not the correct explanation of (A)
Both (A) and (R) are correct and (R) is the correct explanation of (A)
(A) is correct but (R) is not correct

questions.explanation: KOH absorbs $$\text{CO}_2$$ from the air, forming $$\text{K}_2\text{CO}_3$$, which changes its concentration.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.tip_formula: Check KOH concentration due to $$\text{CO}_2$$ absorption.

questions.stem: Which one of the following sets of ions represents a collection of isoelectronic species?
questions.explanation: Isoelectronic species have the same number of electrons. The set $$\text{K}^+, \text{Cl}^-, \text{Ca}^{2+}, \text{Sc}^{3+}$$ all have 18 electrons.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.tip_formula: Count electrons for isoelectronic species.

questions.stem: The effect of addition of helium gas to the following reaction in equilibrium state is: $$\text{PCl}_5(g) \rightleftharpoons \text{PCl}_3(g) + \text{Cl}_2(g)$$

options.text: The equilibrium will shift in the forward direction and more of $$\text{Cl}_2$$ and $$\text{PCl}_3$$ gases will be produced.
The equilibrium will go backward due to suppression of dissociation of $$\text{PCl}_5$$.
Helium will deactivate $$\text{PCl}_5$$ and reaction will stop.
Addition of helium will not affect the equilibrium.

questions.explanation: Adding an inert gas at constant pressure increases the volume, shifting the equilibrium towards the side with more moles of gas.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.tip_formula: Inert gas affects equilibrium at constant pressure.

questions.stem: For electron gain enthalpies of the elements denoted as $$\Delta_{eg}H$$, the incorrect option is:
questions.explanation: The electron gain enthalpy of sulfur is more negative than that of selenium, making option B incorrect.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.tip_formula: Compare electron gain enthalpies across periods.

questions.stem: O–O bond length in $$\text{H}_2\text{O}_2$$ is X than the O–O bond length in $$\text{F}_2\text{O}_2$$. The O–H bond length in $$\text{H}_2\text{O}_2$$ is Y than that of the O–F bond in $$\text{F}_2\text{O}_2$$. Choose the correct option for X and Y from the given below.
questions.explanation: The O–O bond in $$\text{H}_2\text{O}_2$$ is longer due to less s-character in the bond, and the O–H bond is shorter than the O–F bond due to the smaller size of hydrogen compared to fluorine.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.tip_formula: Consider atomic size and bond character for bond lengths.

questions.stem: 0.3 g of ethane undergoes combustion at 27°C in a bomb calorimeter. The temperature of calorimeter system (including the water) is found to rise by 0.5°C. The heat evolved during combustion of ethane at constant pressure is ________kJ mol$$^{-1}$$.
questions.explanation: Using the formula $$\Delta H = \Delta U + \Delta nRT$$, the heat evolved is calculated as 1006 kJ mol$$^{-1}$$.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.tip_formula: Use $$\Delta H = \Delta U + \Delta nRT$$ for combustion calculations.

questions.stem: Among following compounds, the number of those present in copper matte is:
questions.explanation: Copper matte contains $$\text{Cu}_2\text{S}$$ and $$\text{FeS}$$, making the correct count 3.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.tip_formula: Identify components of copper matte.

questions.stem: Among the following, the number of tranquilizer/s is/are:
questions.explanation: Chlorodiazepoxide, Veronal, and Valium are tranquilizers, while Salvarsan is an antibiotic.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.tip_formula: Differentiate between tranquilizers and antibiotics.

questions.stem: The structures of major products A, B, and C in the following reaction sequence are:
questions.explanation: The reaction involves conversion of nitrile to amine and then to carboxylic acid using LiAlH4 and hydrolysis.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.tip_formula: Understand the conversion of nitriles to amines and acids.

questions.stem: Given below are two statements: Assertion (A): $$\text{Cu}^{2+}$$ in water is more stable than $$\text{Cu}^+$$. Reason (R): Enthalpy of hydration for $$\text{Cu}^{2+}$$ is much less than that of $$\text{Cu}^+$$.

options.text: Both (A) and (R) are correct and (R) is the correct explanation of (A).
(A) is correct but (R) is not correct.
(A) is not correct but (R) is correct.
Both (A) and (R) are correct but (R) is not the correct explanation of (A).

questions.explanation: The stability of $$\text{Cu}^{2+}$$ in aqueous solution is due to its higher hydration enthalpy compared to $$\text{Cu}^+$$.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.tip_formula: Consider hydration enthalpy for stability in solutions.

questions.stem: The spin-only magnetic moment of $$[\text{Mn(H}_2\text{O})_6]^{2+}$$ complexes is _______ B.M.
questions.explanation: The magnetic moment is calculated using $$\mu = \sqrt{n(n+2)}$$ where $$n$$ is the number of unpaired electrons. For $$\text{Mn}^{2+}$$, $$n = 5$$.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.tip_formula: Use $$\mu = \sqrt{n(n+2)}$$ for magnetic moment calculations.

questions.stem: A metal M crystallizes into two lattices: face-centered cubic (fcc) and body-centered cubic (bcc) with unit cell edge lengths of 2.0 and 2.5 Å respectively. The ratio of densities of lattices fcc to bcc for the metal M is _______.
questions.explanation: Density is calculated using $$d = \frac{Z \cdot M}{N_A \cdot a^3}$$. For fcc, $$Z = 4$$ and for bcc, $$Z = 2$$.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.tip_formula: Use $$d = \frac{Z \cdot M}{N_A \cdot a^3}$$ for density calculations.

questions.stem: The total number of asymmetric carbon atoms in testosterone is ______.
questions.explanation: Testosterone has six asymmetric carbon atoms, which are chiral centers.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.tip_formula: Identify chiral centers for asymmetric carbon count.

questions.stem: The conductivity of a solution when 1×10–5 M $$\text{AgNO}_3$$ is added to 1 L of saturated solution of $$\text{AgBr}$$ at 298 K is ______×10–8 S m–1.
questions.explanation: Conductivity is calculated using the molar conductivities of ions and their concentrations.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.tip_formula: Use molar conductivities for conductivity calculations.

questions.stem: The molality of a 10% (v/v) solution of di-bromine solution in $$\text{CCl}_4$$ is 'x'. x = ________ × 10–2 M.
questions.explanation: Molality is calculated using the mass of solute and solvent, considering their densities.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.tip_formula: Use density and volume for molality calculations.

questions.stem: 20% of acetic acid is dissociated when its 5 g is added to 500 mL of water. The depression in freezing point of such water is _______ × 10–3 °C.
questions.explanation: The depression in freezing point is calculated using the formula $$\Delta T_f = i K_f m$$ where $$i$$ is the van't Hoff factor.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.tip_formula: Use $$\Delta T_f = i K_f m$$ for freezing point depression.

questions.stem: A reaction A → B is of zero order. Half-life of this reaction is 50 min. The time taken for the concentration of A to reduce to one-fourth of its initial value is _______ min.
questions.explanation: For a zero-order reaction, the time to reduce to one-fourth is calculated using the formula $$t = \frac{3}{2} t_{1/2}$$.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.tip_formula: Use $$t = \frac{3}{2} t_{1/2}$$ for zero-order reactions.

questions.stem: The effect of addition of helium gas to the following reaction in equilibrium state is: $$\text{PCl}_5(g) \rightleftharpoons \text{PCl}_3(g) + \text{Cl}_2(g)$$

options.text: The equilibrium will shift in the forward direction and more of $$\text{Cl}_2$$ and $$\text{PCl}_3$$ gases will be produced.
The equilibrium will go backward due to suppression of dissociation of $$\text{PCl}_5$$.
Helium will deactivate $$\text{PCl}_5$$ and reaction will stop.
Addition of helium will not affect the equilibrium.

questions.explanation: Adding an inert gas at constant pressure increases the volume, shifting the equilibrium towards the side with more moles of gas.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.tip_formula: Inert gas affects equilibrium at constant pressure.
